news_header: A robot artist named Ai-Da will have a portrait of Alan Turing auctioned at Sotheby's, marking a historic sale for a robot-created artwork.
news_text: Ai-Da, a humanoid robot artist powered by AI, is set to make history as the first robot to have a work sold by a major auction house. The portrait of Alan Turing, titled 'AI God,' is expected to fetch up to £150,000 and will be auctioned at Sotheby's in London next month. The artwork, described as 'haunting,' was first exhibited at the United Nations in May 2024. Ai-Da, designed to resemble a human female, uses AI algorithms and has cameras in its eyes. Gallery owner Aidan Meller, who led the creation of Ai-Da, noted that Turing's concerns about AI's power in the 1950s are reflected in the artwork's muted tones. The auction will take place from October 31 to November 7.
